Posts.Content: TommiRB wrote: Hello all, I was on these boards a long long time ago when Dx with BC Stage 2 in August 2011. After 8 rounds of aggresive chemo and 6 years of Arimidex, I figured I was doing well and celebrated 10 years of survivorship on 8/15/11.  Unfortunately some spots were found on my spine during an MRI for a herniated disc...ortho had me revisit onco, and spots on spine were fine, but the ones on pelvis were worrisome. After the bone biopsy (oy - was that a charm) - I found out on 9/12/11 that I was now Stage IV with bone mets. Less than a month after a MAJOR celebration, the beast is back. I currently get a monthly shot of Xgeva and daily Aromasin. Between the 2, I have some major pain in hip and knees..It's a lot tougher going through this at 55 instead off 44 when first Dx. So we have added pain meds for me to be able to function with quality. There is no true prognosis for any of us in this situation - so I just want to have a good quality of whatever time I have left - hopefully after every year or two, there will be more to help those of us with mets. Just wanted to say hi again and I know I can come here for support and hopefully to help others as well as we all continue to fight this!!! Shine on everyone!! Tommi Dx 8/15/01 Stage 2..Dx Stage 4 bone mets 9/12/11..ER+/PR+ HER2- Surgery 8/14/2001 Mastectomy: Right; Reconstruction (right): Free TRAM flap Chemotherapy 9/27/2001 CEF Hormonal Therapy 2/27/2002 Arimidex (anastrozole) Hormonal Therapy 10/7/2011 Aromasin (exemestane) Radiation Therapy 10/7/2011 Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Apr 13, 2012 05:56PM TommiRB wrote: I also have trouble sleeping, but I am very fortunate in that I do not have a job outside of the home - it's the Aromasin that causes the bone and joint pain and have the nasty night sweats also due to this drug. It also seems worse about 2 days after the Xgeva shot.  I take at least 1 nap a day. I am very productive in the morning, even if I wake up at 4am. By the afternoon, I'm a goner - napping on my sofa for about 2 hours. I do take a 5mg of valium some nights, but most of the time I just keep it very cool in the house and a glass of water on my nightstand. I would most likely be a "poster" if there was a "Can't Sleep" forum. Good luck and I agree that a change in medication schedule may help - it certainly can't hurt. Good Luck!! Tommi
